name: Motion Intent
summary: Protocol defining the application's physics, latency tolerance, and transition behavior.
description:
Physics Contract

  • natural: Mass-based physics (springs), context-aware transitions.
  • immediate: < 16ms latency. Disables decorative motion for high-performance workflows.
  • reduced: Semantic motion only (e.g. layout shifts), disabling parallax/scaling. Respects prefers-reduced-motion.

name: Density Intent
summary: Protocol defining spatial relationships, touch targets, and information quantity.
description:
Spatial Contract

  • comfortable: 44px+ touch targets. Whitespace is used for grouping (Consumer standard).
  • compact: 32px targets. High information density, border-based grouping (Enterprise standard).
  • wafer: 24px targets. Maximum data visibility for complex tooling/IDE interfaces.

name: Interaction Intent
summary: Protocol defining the input modality and focus management behavior.
description:
Input Contract

  • pointer: Fine-grained control. Hover menus enabled, scrollbars visible.
  • touch: Coarse control. Swipe actions replace hover menus. Hit testing padding applied.
  • gamepad: Spatial Navigation (D-Pad). Focus is trapped within active regions (Sunsetting tab-index logic).

name: Prefetch Intent
summary: Controls the eagerness of resource prefetching based on connection and power.
description:
Trigger Profile (Eagerness)

  • viewport: Active when link enters visual viewport (Lazy).
  • hover: Active on hover (>200ms) or focus (Moderate).
  • interaction: Active on pointerdown (Eager).

Constraints (The "No-Go" List)

  • Save-Data: Abort if navigator.connection.saveData is true.
  • Battery: Abort prerendering if battery < 20% or unplugged.
  • Slow Connection: Abort if effectiveType is 2g/slow-2g.

name: Loader Intent
summary: Protocol defining how a pending state affects the user interface via Blocking, Scoping, and Timing profiles.
description:
Blocking Strategy

  • optimistic: Non-blocking. UI remains fully interactive (background sync).
  • soft: Input-blocking. Applies aria-disabled and pointer-events: none. Content remains visible.
  • hard: Visual-blocking. Content is obscured or overlaid (Backdrop).
  • replacement: Content-blocking. Placeholder content (Skeleton) temporarily replaces the view.

Scope Definition

  • element: Constrained to the triggering target (e.g., Button spinner).
  • region: Constrained to the containing landmark (e.g., aria-busy on the Form).
  • viewport: Global interruption (Glass pane).

Timing Contract

Maps semantic timing profiles to configurable durations (ms). Applications can override defaults or register new profiles.

  • immediate: Defaults to 0ms (Configurable).
  • debounced: Defaults to 400ms (Configurable). Prevents flicker.
  • [custom]: User-defined keys (e.g., slow: 1000ms).

Lifecycle Events

  • enter: Loader becomes visible (after timing delay).
  • exit: Loader is removed or hidden.

Interface Protocol

type BlockingStrategy = 'optimistic' | 'soft' | 'hard' | 'replacement';
type LoaderScope = 'element' | 'region' | 'viewport';

interface LoaderIntent {
    // How the UI is blocked
    strategy: BlockingStrategy;
    // What part of the UI is affected
    scope: LoaderScope;
    // When the loader appears (referencing Config.timings)
    timing: 'immediate' | 'debounced' | string;
    // Accessibility label
    label?: string;
    // Motion bindings
    animations?: Partial>;
}

Provisioning Example

const LoaderConfig = {
    timings: {
        debounced: 400,
        complex: 800
    },
    defaults: {
        region: { strategy: 'soft', timing: 'debounced' }
    }
};

injector Application {
    provide { Loader } to '@web-intents' from './components/GlobalLoader';
    provide { LoaderConfig } to '@web-intents/loader';
}

name: Validation Intent
summary: Protocol defining validation lifecycle, message placement contexts, and state commit policies per severity level.
description:
Message Context

  • control: Inline with the specific input (e.g., Red border + message).
  • group: Summary for a fieldset/section (e.g., "Address is incomplete").
  • form: Aggregate list at top (e.g., "Please fix 3 errors below").
  • root: Global toast or banner (e.g., System-wide validation).

Severity & Data Commit

  • error: Substantive. State is Rejected (not committed). Blocks submission.
  • warning: Advisory. State is Committed. Submission allowed.
  • caution: Critical. State is Held until user overrides confirmation.
  • info: Educational. State is Committed. Helper text only.
  • [custom]: App-specific levels (e.g. audit). Behavior defined by commits flag.

Lifecycle Events

  • enter: Validation message appears.
  • exit: Validation resolved or field cleared.
  • pulse: Re-triggering the same error (e.g., Submit clicked again).

Interface Protocol

type ValidationContext = 'control' | 'group' | 'form' | 'root' | string;
type CommitTrigger = 'change' | 'blur' | 'submit';

interface ValidationLevel {
    name: 'error' | 'warning' | 'caution' | 'info' | string;
    // Does this severity block data persistence?
    commits: boolean;
}

interface ValidationIntent {
    // Severity configuration including commit policy
    level: ValidationLevel;
    
    // Where the message is displayed
    context: ValidationContext;
    
    // Lifecycle Configuration
    execution: 'change' | 'blur' | 'submit';
    visibility: 'immediate' | 'dirty' | 'touched' | 'submitted';
    
    // When the data is committed to state (Control context)
    commitOn: CommitTrigger[];
    // Motion bindings
    animations?: Partial>;
}

name: Modal Intent
summary: Protocol defining dialog behavior including stacking, scrolling, sizing, and dismissal strategies.
description:
Placement & Docking

  • center: Standard dialog.
  • top/bottom: Sheet/Drawer behavior (Mobile standard).
  • start/end: Sidebar/Panel behavior.
  • fill: Full-screen override.

Focus Management

  • trap: Keeps focus within modal (Accessibility Requirement).
  • restore: Returns focus to trigger when closed.
  • initial: Default focus element (e.g., First input vs Close button).

Lifecycle Events

  • enter: Modal opens and becomes active.
  • exit: Modal closes.
  • recede: Modal moves to background (when a new stacked modal opens).
  • advance: Modal moves to foreground (when the top stacked modal closes).

Design System Alignment

SystemComponentPlacementBackdropDismissal
Material 3Basic Dialogcenterdimmedlight
Material 3Full-screenfilltransparentexplicit
CarbonModaltopdimmedexplicit
Apple HIGSheetbottomdimmedlight
Radix UIDialogcenterdimmedlight

Interface Protocol

type Dismissal = 'light' | 'explicit' | 'none';
type Placement = 'center' | 'top' | 'bottom' | 'start' | 'end' | 'fill';
type Backdrop = 'dimmed' | 'transparent' | 'blur';

interface FocusStrategy {
    trap: boolean;
    restore: boolean;
    initial?: string; // Selector
}

interface ModalIntent {
    // Role (ARIA)
    role: 'dialog' | 'alertdialog';
    // Visual placement
    placement: Placement;
    // Interaction Mode (Blocks background?)
    mode: 'modal' | 'modeless';
    // Mobile Snap Points (Sheet)
    detents?: { initial: 'medium' | 'large' | 'full'; stops: string[] };
    // Backdrop visual
    backdrop: Backdrop;
    // How the modal can be closed
    dismissal: Dismissal | 'gesture';
    // Focus Management
    focus: FocusStrategy;
    // Allow other modals on top?
    stackable: boolean;
    // Scroll strategy
    scrolling: 'contained' | 'viewport';
    // Responsive sizing map
    size: 'auto' | 'fullscreen' | Record<string, string>;
    // Motion bindings
    animations?: Partial>;
}

name: Action Intent
summary: Protocol defining the semantic hierarchy (levels) of interactive elements to establish visual priority.
description:
Action Levels

  • primary: Principal call to action. Maps to FAB (Material) or Solid Button (Fluent).
  • secondary: Alternative actions. Maps to Outlined or Tonal buttons.
  • tertiary: Supplemental actions. Maps to Text/Ghost buttons (Low impact).
  • destructive: Negative actions. Often implies specific color semantics (Red).

Grouping & Alignment

Controls spatial relationships for collections of actions (e.g., Dialog footers, Toolbars).

  • ordering: Platform-aware (Mac: Primary Last, Win: Primary First) vs DOM (As is).
  • sizing: Stretch (Mobile bar) vs Auto (Desktop).
  • placement: End (Dialogs), Start (Forms), Split (Navs).

Busy State Protocol

Configuration for asynchronous pending states.

  • loader: Reference to visual token from Loader definition.
  • lockWidth: Prevents layout shift during content changes.
  • loaderPosition: Relative placement of the indicator.

Interface Protocol

type ActionLevel = 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'tertiary' | 'destructive' | string;
type LoaderPosition = 'start' | 'end' | 'center' | 'overlay';

interface BusySchema {
    // Disable interaction?
    disabled: boolean;
    // Token reference (e.g. 'spinner')
    loader?: string;
    // Indicator placement
    loaderPosition: LoaderPosition;
    // Temporary text replacement
    text?: string;
    // Hide original label?
    hideLabel?: boolean;
    // Prevent layout shift?
    lockWidth: boolean;
    // Visibility override
    visibility?: 'visible' | 'hidden' | 'collapsed';
}

interface ActionIcon {
    // Default icon name/glyph
    name?: string;
    // Size reference (Icon Intent)
    size?: 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg' | string;
    // Placement relative to label
    position?: 'start' | 'end';
}

interface ActionGroupIntent {
    alignment: 'start' | 'end' | 'center' | 'justify' | 'split';
    ordering: 'dom' | 'reverse' | 'platform'; // platform = adapting primary position
    sizing: 'auto' | 'stretch' | 'uniform';
}

interface ActionIntent {
    // The semantic weight
    level: ActionLevel;
    // Pending state behavior
    busy?: Partial;
    // Icon configuration
    icon?: ActionIcon;
    // Density/Spacing reference (e.g. 'comfortable')
    density?: string;
    // Grouping Context (for Collections)
    group?: ActionGroupIntent;
}

name: Icon Intent
summary: Protocol defining iconography standards including sizing scales, weight, and positioning strategies.
description:
Sizing Scale

  • sm: Small (e.g., 16px). For inline text or tight density.
  • md: Medium (e.g., 20px). Standard usage.
  • lg: Large (e.g., 24px). Feature icons or comfortable buttons.
  • xl: Extra Large (e.g., 32px+). Hero or empty states.

Interface Protocol

type IconSize = 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg' | 'xl' | string;

interface IconIntent {
    // The visual size identifier
    size: IconSize;
    // Name of the icon asset/glyph
    name: string;
    // Stroke weight (if variable)
    weight?: 'light' | 'regular' | 'bold';
    // Render style
    style?: 'outlined' | 'filled';
}

name: Breakpoint Intent
summary: Protocol defining display adaptation strategies, abstracting viewport tiers and container queries.
description:
Adaptation Strategy

  • mobile-first: Standard accumulation. Used by Tailwind, Bootstrap.
  • desktop-first: Legacy subtraction.
  • strict-range: Bucket-based slots. Used by Material Design 3.

Interface Protocol

type Strategy = 'mobile-first' | 'desktop-first' | 'strict-range';
type Unit = 'px' | 'em' | 'rem';

interface BreakpointConfig {
    unit: Unit;
    strategy: Strategy;
    // ordered map of screen sizes
    steps: Record<string, number | { min: number; max: number }>;
    // aliases for logical groups
    aliases?: Record<string, string[]>;
}

interface BreakpointIntent {
    // The current active breakpoint token
    readonly active: string;
    // Configuration of the system
    readonly config: BreakpointConfig;
    // Query matcher
    matches(query: string | { up?: string; down?: string; only?: string }): boolean;
}

name: Typography Intent
summary: Protocol abstracting visual hierarchy from semantic HTML, normalizing roles across Design Systems.
description:
Role Definition

  • display: Expressive/Decorative (Hero, Splash). Low density.
  • heading: Structural hierarchy (H1-H6 markers).
  • body: focused on Readability (Long-form content).
  • label: focused on Legibility (UI Components, Buttons).
  • code: Monospace technical data.

Interface Protocol

type TypographyRole = 'display' | 'heading' | 'body' | 'label' | 'code';
// T-shirt scale relative to the Role base size
type TypographyScale = 'xs' | 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg' | 'xl';

interface ToneFeatures {
    // Force monospace numbers (Data Grids)
    tabular?: boolean;
    // Overflow behavior
    truncation?: 'clip' | 'ellipsis' | 'fade';
    // Disable definition-based optical sizing
    opticalSizing?: 'auto' | 'none';
}

interface TypographyIntent {
    // The semantic purpose
    role: TypographyRole;
    // Relative size/emphasis within that role
    scale?: TypographyScale;
    // Rendering constraints
    features?: ToneFeatures;
}

name: Surface Intent
summary: Protocol defining Z-Axis depth, material texture (Glass/Solid), and interactions across lighting modes.
description:
Elevation Semantics (Z-Axis)

  • 0: Base. Application background.
  • 1-2: Grouping content. (Cards, Lists).
  • 3-5: Floating content. (Sticky Headers, Modals, Tooltips).

Material Texture

  • solid: Opaque. Standard for Material Design 3 (Surface Tones).
  • glass: Blurred background. Standard for macOS/iOS (Vibrancy) and Windows (Mica/Acrylic).
  • transparent: Layout-only containment.

Interface Protocol

type SurfaceMaterial = 'solid' | 'glass' | 'transparent';
type SurfaceInteraction = 'static' | 'lift' | 'scale';

interface SurfaceIntent {
    // Z-axis position relative to parent (0-5)
    elevation: number;
    
    // Physical texture of the surface
    texture: SurfaceMaterial;
    
    // Visual variation (Default vs High Contrast)
    variant: 'default' | 'alt';
    
    // Interaction physics
    interaction: SurfaceInteraction;
}

name: Feedback Intent
summary: Protocol defining transient, non-blocking messaging (Toasts/Snackbars) and their queuing logic.
description:
Placement Logic

  • top-end: Standard for Desktop notifications (Toasts).
  • bottom-start: Standard for Material Design (Snackbars). Avoids FAB interaction.
  • top-center: Mobile alerts.

Timing & Duration

  • short: ~4000ms. For simple confirmations ("Saved").
  • long: ~10000ms. If text > 60 chars.
  • indefinite: Remains until dismissed. Required if an Action is present (Accessibility).

Interface Protocol

type FeedbackPlacement = 'top-start' | 'top-end' | 'bottom-start' | 'bottom-end' | 'top-center' | 'bottom-center';
type FeedbackSeverity = 'info' | 'success' | 'warning' | 'error';

interface FeedbackAction {
    label: string;
    intent: string;
}

interface FeedbackIntent {
    // Positioning strategy
    placement: FeedbackPlacement;
    // Semantic weight
    severity: FeedbackSeverity;
    // Persistence
    duration: 'short' | 'long' | 'indefinite';
    // Queue Management (1 = Single/Replace, >1 = Stack)
    stackLimit: number;
    // Optional interactive element (e.g. "Undo")
    action?: FeedbackAction;
}

name: Selection Intent
summary: Protocol defining choice behaviors (Single vs Multi) and state urgency, distinguishing interactions from form data.
description:
Choice Models

  • single: Mutually exclusive. Renders as Radio (Forms), Switch (Settings), or Select (Compact).
  • multiple: Accumulative. Renders as Checkbox (List) or Filter Chips (Toolbar).

Immediacy Profile

  • live: State changes immediately (Settings toggle).
  • buffered: State changes on submission (Form field).

Interface Protocol

type SelectionModel = 'single' | 'multiple';
type SelectionVariant = 'boolean' | 'item' | 'range';

interface SelectionIntent {
    // How many can be selected
    model: SelectionModel;
    // When the state is committed
    immediacy: 'live' | 'buffered';
    // Visual metaphor
    variant: SelectionVariant;
    // Constraints
    constraints?: { min?: number; max?: number };
}

name: Input Intent
summary: Protocol for text entry standardization including affordances, privacy masking, and visual variants.
description:
Visual Variants

  • outlined: High contrast (Material default). Defined boundary.
  • filled: High emphasis background (Fluent/Material).
  • borderless: Minimalist (iOS List style).

Affordances

  • clear: 'X' button to reset value.
  • reveal: Eye icon for passwords.
  • copy: Clipboard action.

Interface Protocol

type InputVariant = 'outlined' | 'filled' | 'borderless';
type InputAffordance = 'clear' | 'reveal' | 'copy';

interface InputIntent {
    // Visual style
    variant: InputVariant;
    // Privacy masking (dots)
    masking: boolean;
    // Interaction helpers
    affordances: InputAffordance[];
    // State
    status: 'enabled' | 'disabled' | 'readonly';
}

name: Navigation Intent
summary: Protocol defining application structure (Hierarchical, Lateral, Linear) and view transition logic.
description:
Structure Model

  • hierarchical: Parent/Child stack. Managing history and back-navigation.
  • lateral: Peer switching (Tabs, Bottom Nav). No history stack.
  • linear: Sequential steps (Wizard). Locked progression.

name: Anchor Intent
summary: Protocol for tethered surfaces (Tooltips, Menus) defining placement and collision physics.
description:
Tether Contract

  • tooltip: Informational. Hover/Focus trigger. Non-interactive.
  • popover: Interactive content. Click trigger. Traps focus if modal.
  • menu: Action list. Click/Context trigger. Keyboard navigable.

name: Temporal Intent
summary: Protocol abstracting date/time selection paradigms across mouse, touch, and keyboard modalities.
description:
Presentation Paradigms

  • media: Spatial surfaces. Wall calendars (Grid) or Analog Clocks.
  • linear: Sequential lists. Scrolling Wheels (iOS) or Listboxes.
  • input: Text-based. Masked inputs or simple native fallbacks.

Granularity

  • point: Single instance (Date/Time).
  • range: Span between two points.
  • multi: Disconnected sets of points.

name: Layout Intent
summary: Protocol defining the application shell structure and region mechanics (Drawers, Rails, Panels).
description:
Region Behavior

  • push: Region consumes space, shifting the main content (Desktop).
  • overlay: Region floats above content with a backdrop (Mobile).
  • rail: Region collapses to a thin strip (Icons) rather than disappearing.

Anatomy

  • shell: The global viewport container.
  • pane: A resizable subdivision of the shell.
  • dock: A sticky region (Header/Footer).

name: Message Intent
summary: Protocol defining communication priority (Attention) and structural anatomy across alerts, banners, and dialogs.
description:
Attention Hierarchy

  • ambient: Low priority. Status bars or helper text.
  • routine: Standard priority. Toasts or inline notes.
  • urgent: High priority. Banners or System Alerts.
  • critical: Blocking priority. Dialogs or Screen Takeovers.

Tone Semantics

  • neutral: Information.
  • positive: Success/Confirmation.
  • caution: Warning/Non-blocking error.
  • negative: Error/Destructive.

name: Reliability Intent
summary: Protocol defining error recovery strategies, retry policies, and outcome handling (Forgiving vs Terminal).
description:
Outcomes & Tolerance

  • forgivable: Operation failed but app state is valid. Logged silently or shown as a toast.
  • degraded: Partial failure. UI renders with missing data or fallback content.
  • terminal: Broken state. Component cannot render. Requires replacement (Error Boundary).

Retry Policy

  • immediate: Retries instantly (for simple timeouts).
  • linear: Constant delay between attempts (e.g. 1s, 1s, 1s).
  • exponential: Increasing delay (1s, 2s, 4s). Standard for network handling.

Status Mapping

  • 4xx: Client Error. Generally Terminal (Bad Request) or Forgivable (Validation). No Retry.
  • 5xx: Server Error. Generally Terminal (Service Down) unless transient (Gateway Timeout). Exponential Retry.
  • Offline: Transient. Queued or background retry.

Interface Protocol

type RetryStrategy = 'none' | 'immediate' | 'linear' | 'exponential';
type ErrorTolerance = 'forgivable' | 'degraded' | 'terminal';

interface ReliabilityIntent {
    // How many times to attempt
    retries: number;
    // Algo for spacing attempts
    policy: RetryStrategy;
    // Severity of failure
    tolerance: ErrorTolerance;
    // Fallback content definition
    fallback?: 'skeleton' | 'empty' | 'previous';
}
